data.title: Training
data.text:
DDSCP Training Courses and Events

The Derby and Derbyshire Safeguarding Children Partnership provides general and specialist courses to help build staff skills, knowledge, values and confidence when working with children, young people and families.

The training offer consists of a blended approach of events (virtual and classroom based), e-learning courses, videos and briefings. Training is co-delivered by the DDSCP Training Officer and a multi-agency pool of specialist facilitators.

Multi-agency training is available for volunteers and practitioners working across Derby and Derbyshire only. Any organisations or agencies outside of Derby and Derbyshire who would like to access our training should contact the Partnership via DDSCPTraining@derby.gov.uk

View our Training Offer

Click here for more information on our multi-agency training and e-learning courses.

Course Booking

To book on any course you will need to register and create an account.

Please register or log in here to access the booking system.

Please use the How to create a training account guide on setting up your account. Once you have done this, you will be able to:

Manage your own bookings

Download course materials

Access course evaluations

Download your certificate of attendance (a course evaluation must be completed first)

Access your training history

Update your own details if you change role or organisation

Reset your own password

Important: Delegates must create their own individual account. The account is linked to the email address you provide and certificates will only be issued in the name on that account. Please also see Information for delegates.

Not sure what training you need?

If you are not sure what training you require, please speak to your organisation in the first instance. Agencies are expected to provide safeguarding training for their staff relevant to their role. It is not the DDSCPâ€™s responsibility to provide assurance of staff.

Please ensure that you have carefully read the Multi-Agency Training Pathway document before booking onto a multi-agency course.

To support you, please follow these steps:

First step

Consider your specific work role with children, young people and their families and reflect on your learning needs.

Second step

Decide which courses are relevant to your role. Discuss and agree with your line manager which training course is appropriate to attend.

Third step

Apply for a course through our online booking system.

An automatic email will be sent to you and your line manager confirming your booking. If you do not receive a booking confirmation, then you have not been successful in securing a place and should not attend training.

Automatic emails will also be sent if you cancel your booking or fail to attend. These emails will also be sent to your Line Manager. For all staff working for the Statutory Partners, non-attendance will be followed up by your agency.
